featured.text: In 1761, while living in England, Franklin heard a performer playing musical glasses.
Franklin ran an iron rod through a hole in the top of each hemisphere so that they could nest together from largest to smallest.
Franklin moistened his fingers and held them against the rims of the glass hemispheres as they turned, producing a unique sound.
Which of the following is the closest illustration of Benjamin Franklin’s invention?

other.text: Franklin was charmed by the music, but felt that there was a better way to create the same sound.
So, alas, Franklin’s marvelous invention was ultimately abandoned.

definition.zh_def: 富蘭克林，通常指本傑明·富蘭克林（Benjamin Franklin），美國的政治家、科學家和發明家。
definition.en_def: Franklin typically refers to Benjamin Franklin, an American statesman, scientist, and inventor.
definition.example: Benjamin Franklin was one of the Founding Fathers of the United States.
